snippet: From the pool to the pitch and many arenas in between, Olympic champions face moral questions on the way to the podium.
abstract: London Games have demonstrated that medal standing is not necessarily a barometer of moral character; from the pool to the pitch and in many arenas between, Olympic champions are finding many shades of gray on the way to the podium; exploiting loopholes in the rules, or in their enforcement, appears to have become a 37th sport in these Games.
lead_paragraph: From the pool to the pitch and many arenas in between, Olympic champions face moral questions on the way to the podium.

headline.seo: Athletes Face Quandary Over Bending the Rules at Olympics
headline.main: Shades of Gray on Way to Podium
headline.print_headline: Shades Of Gray On Way To Podium
